result.execSummary:
The defendant Emmit Gerrod Price was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: First 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges to the Day Reporting Center for drug treatment and any job services. (DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT). Credit for 7 days time served.

Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge; and pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid within 90 days of release.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmit Gerrod Price

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Early Release; signed and filed.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. M. Joseph Donald, Br. 2, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for an "early release."
Thank you letter to Judge Donald; from the defendant - filed.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements made by the victim, Sandra V.
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION.  First 90 days are to be served as straight time.  As to the remaining 9 months, Court allows release privileges to the Day Reporting Center for drug treatment and any job services. Credit for 7 days time served.

COURT ORDERS:
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if one has not already been given; pay DNA surcharge - to be paid within 90 days of release.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid within 90 days of release.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- No contact with the victim, Sandra V.
- Restitution is set at ZERO.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

(DEFENDANT REMANDED INTO CUSTODY WITH THE SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT IN COURT)

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached Restitution Worksheet.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY "as charged". Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price appeared in court.
ADA Tyrone St. Junior appeared for Joanne L. Hardtke on behalf of the State.
No other appearances.

Matter in court on a WALK-IN BASIS for a Justice Point Violation Review Hearing.
Defendant received a violation for a positive cocaine drug screen "again".  
Statements made.  
Court is now frustrated.
Court admonished defendant for receiving the positive drug screen and advised him that his release on bail is at stake.

Court ordered the conditions of bail to remain the same.

Case adjourned to the already scheduled Plea and Sentencing Hearing date on 07-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial "Violation" Report.

14RM034615  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-11-14
COURT RAISES SUPERVISION LEVEL TO INTENSIVE SUPERVISION.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case worker MICHELLE DROTT.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for PLEA/SENTENCING on JULY 29, 2014 in Branch 02.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  
JUSTICE POINT Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report with attached positive drug screen report; received and filed.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Plea Hearing today, however, the parties are not ready to proceed.
Parties are still under negotiations.

Court addressed the Justice Point Violation Report:  Defendant received a violation for a positive cocaine drug screen.  Statements made.  Court admonished defendant for receiving the positive drug screen and advised him that his release on bail is at stake.

Court ordered the conditions of bail to remain the same.

Case adjourned to 07-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial "Violation" Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Timothy Cotter for Joanne L Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Statements made.
Defense requests a projected plea hearing date in 45 days.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 06-25-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Caitlin Ringersma for Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/9/14.

14RM018510  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03-31-14

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Sandra V.

Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Emmit Gerrod Price in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
